items.content_html: Such a strange feeling when remnants of your distant past, which should be long gone, still exist. Hope‚Äôs was our regular barbershop in my early teenage years. Tom Hope has long since retired, and the shop has been home to various Mexican eateries since then‚Äîbut the signage remains.

items.content_html: Torn between hosting my WordPress blog in AWS (where it has been since EC2 was a new thing) and WordPress.com. (Yeah, I know, the correct answer is “neither, Micro.blog”. I’ll get there, but because it’s a native WordPress blog, I like to keep it in WordPress for now.)
items.content_text: Torn between hosting my WordPress blog in AWS (where it has been since EC2 was a new thing) and WordPress.com. (Yeah, I know, the correct answer is "neither, Micro.blog". I'll get there, but because it's a native WordPress blog, I like to keep it in WordPress for now.)

items.content_html: I always have the Veo app on my iPhone with a residual balance from our trips to L.A., but until now, I could never use it here. I doubt I ever will, though. I’ve always found these things to be outrageously overpriced for regular use.

items.content_html: A perfect summery day to decompress, and fortunately, the week is ending better than it began.
items.content_text: A perfect summery day to decompress, and fortunately, the week is ending better than it began.

items.content_html: Mentally in a better place today and actually able to enjoy the beautiful weather. My weekend plumbing saga put me in such a deep funk that I was barely able to function, but things came together and (fingers crossed) it should be behind me now. (My headspace got so bad at one point yesterday, I dragged my wife to look at a house for rent. Luckily for her, it ended up being way too far outside of the city for my taste.)
items.content_text: Mentally in a better place today and actually able to enjoy the beautiful weather. My weekend [plumbing](https://micro.mikedunn.blog/2025/04/19/gorgeous-saturday-ruined-by-a/) [saga](https://micro.mikedunn.blog/2025/04/20/my-seemingly-simple-drain-clog/) put me in such a deep funk that I was barely able to function, but things came together and (fingers crossed) it should be behind me now. (My headspace got so bad at one point yesterday, I dragged my wife to look at a house for rent. Luckily for her, it ended up being way too far outside of the city for my taste.)

items.content_html: We had the best quirky technology in the ’80s. Here’s yours truly with a toy wireless microphone and my beloved Emerson boombox (a combo AM/FM radio, cassette recorder, and television!) My budding radio career captured nicely in one photo.
items.content_text: We had the best quirky technology in the '80s. Here's yours truly with a toy wireless microphone and my beloved Emerson boombox (a combo AM/FM radio, cassette recorder, and _television_!) My budding radio career captured nicely in one photo.

items.content_html: My seemingly simple drain clog yesterday went sideways spectacularly, and now it’s going to become a weeks-long ordeal. I feel like I’ve hit a breaking point with homeownership. I know every homeowner deals with this type of thing, but I’ve just never been wired for it.
items.content_text: My seemingly simple drain clog yesterday went sideways spectacularly, and now it's going to become a weeks-long ordeal. I feel like I've hit a breaking point with homeownership. I know every homeowner deals with this type of thing, but I've just never been wired for it.

items.content_html: Gorgeous Saturday ruined by a clogged drain. Of course, the clog isn’t in the trap. And, of course, the DIY remedies didn’t work. And, of course, it’s the weekend and a holiday weekend. And, of course, every plumber has an answering service that simply takes a message. Homeownership: 0, renting: 1.
items.content_text: Gorgeous Saturday ruined by a clogged drain. Of course, the clog isn't in the trap. And, of course, the DIY remedies didn't work. And, of course, it's the weekend and a _holiday_ weekend. And, of course, every plumber has an answering service that simply takes a message. Homeownership: 0, renting: 1.

items.content_html: A wonderful art installation around the Park of Roses called the “Squirrel Door Project” appeared today. Most of the doors are squirrel-themed, naturally, but this one spoke to me by showcasing my favorite (but seemingly unloved by society) candy bar, Zagnut.
items.content_text: A wonderful art installation around the Park of Roses called the "[Squirrel Door Project](https://clintonvilleartsguild.com/squirrel-door-project)" appeared today. Most of the doors are squirrel-themed, naturally, but this one spoke to me by showcasing my favorite (but seemingly unloved by society) candy bar, Zagnut.

items.content_html: As a kid, I used to play hooky just to stay home and binge the daytime game shows on USA Network ‚Äî especially Tic-Tac-Dough and High Rollers with Wink Martindale. The big hair, the flashy suits, the huge smile ‚Äî he was truly the consummate game show host. RIP.
items.content_text: As a kid, I used to play hooky just to stay home and binge the daytime game shows on USA Network ‚Äî especially _Tic-Tac-Dough_ and _High Rollers_ with Wink Martindale. The big hair, the flashy suits, the huge smile ‚Äî he was truly the consummate game show host. RIP.

items.content_html:
My WNKO fam getting a shout out on Reddit:

IHeart has ruined Columbus Radio

Stations I grew up listening to like QFM and 93.3 are unlistenable with the long ads and same playlists of songs. 101.7 seems like the only station left with short ads and an actual variety of music.
items.content_text:
My [WNKO](https://wnko.com/) fam getting a shout out [on Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/Columbus/comments/1k09wwm/iheart_has_ruined_columbus_radio/):

> IHeart has ruined Columbus Radio
>
>Stations I grew up listening to like QFM and 93.3 are unlistenable with the long ads and same playlists of songs. 101.7 seems like the only station left with short ads and an actual variety of music.

items.content_html:
Trump privately said he was aware that his broad and steep plan for levies unveiled last week could tip the economy into a recession, but he didn‚Äôt want a depression, according to a Wednesday night report from the paper, citing people familiar with the conversations. ‚Äî Alex Harring

That he knew he was doing something that could have tipped us into a depression ‚Äî not a recession but a depression ‚Äî is just unbelievably reckless.
items.content_text:
> Trump privately said he was aware that his broad and steep plan for levies unveiled last week could tip the economy into a recession, but he didn‚Äôt want a depression, according to a [Wednesday night report](https://www.wsj.com/politics/policy/why-trump-blinked-on-tariffs-b588aea8?mod=WSJ_home_supertoppertop_pos_1) from the paper, citing people familiar with the conversations. ‚Äî [Alex Harring](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/04/10/trump-acknowledged-he-could-cause-a-recession-but-just-didnt-want-a-depression-according-to-wsj.html)

That he knew he was doing something that could have tipped us into a depression ‚Äî not a recession but a _depression_ ‚Äî is just unbelievably reckless.

items.title: CNBC: Stock market posts third biggest gain in post-WWII history on Trump‚Äôs tariff about-face
items.content_html: Days like today are precisely why you shouldn’t attempt to time the market. Regardless of the reasons behind it, you don’t want to miss these.
items.content_text: [Days like today](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/04/09/stock-market-posts-third-biggest-gain-in-post-wwii-history-on-trumps-tariff-about-face.html) are precisely why you shouldn't attempt to time the market. Regardless of the reasons behind it, you don't want to miss these.

items.content_html: If you grew up in the ’60s, or if you were an ’80s Nickelodeon kid like me, I’m sure you remember Jay North very well. I always wondered what became of him in later years (never would’ve guessed corrections officer, but it’s kind of poetic if you think about it). RIP.
items.content_text: If you grew up in the '60s, or if you were an '80s Nickelodeon kid like me, I'm sure you remember Jay North very well. I always wondered what became of him in later years (never would've guessed corrections officer, but it's kind of poetic if you think about it). RIP.

Vinyl records and CDs of Peter Cetera’s “Glory of Love,” Dionne Warwick’s “That’s What Friends Are For,” Shai’s “If I Ever Fall in Love,” and House of Pain’s “Jump Around” are displayed.

items.content_html: Spent some time today clicking around pricing VPS providers to compare against AWS. Started feeling a little sticker shock until I remembered paying around $300 a month for a dedicated Rackspace server back in 1999 ($577 in today’s dollars). ü§™
items.content_text: Spent some time today clicking around pricing VPS providers to compare against AWS. Started feeling a little sticker shock until I remembered paying around $300 a month for a dedicated Rackspace server back in 1999 ([$577 in today's dollars](https://www.amortization.org/inflation/amount.php?year=1999&amount=300)). ü§™

items.content_html: I avoid spending a lot of time looking at the works of high-profile photographers. I don’t want to find myself trying to copy them (and, as we all know, “comparison is the thief of joy”). But, flipping through Vivian Maier’s photographs is always time well spent. Very inspiring.
items.content_text: I avoid spending a lot of time looking at the works of high-profile photographers. I don't want to find myself trying to copy them (and, as we all know, "comparison is the thief of joy"). But, flipping through Vivian Maier's photographs is always time well spent. Very inspiring.

items.content_html: One of my odd habits is glancing at the dates on manhole covers as we’re taking May on her sniff walks. It’s an interesting way of dating development of an area, kind of like rings in a tree. Most of our neighborhood has dates in the 1950s, but today I found one dated 1927.
items.content_text: One of my odd habits is glancing at the dates on manhole covers as we're taking May on her sniff walks. It's an interesting way of dating development of an area, kind of like rings in a tree. Most of our neighborhood has dates in the 1950s, but today I found one dated 1927.

items.content_html: CVS pharmacies are such a shitshow. Voice prompt hell. Incorrect information from pharmacists. Incorrect information on their website. And don’t try to get anything done between 1:30p and 2p because the whole operation shuts down “for lunch”. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

items.content_html:
Finished reading: The World According to Mister Rogers: Important Things to Remember by Fred Rogers üìö Timeless and timely. It’s hard not to feel like society has become so cynical and negative and tribal that people are more likely to ridicule these thoughts than consider them. I hope I’m wrong.

“We want to raise our children so that they can take a sense of pleasure in both their own heritage and the diversity of others.” ‚Äî Fred Rogers
items.content_text:
Finished reading: [The World According to Mister Rogers: Important Things to Remember](https://micro.blog/books/9781401398682) by Fred Rogers üìö Timeless _and_ timely. It's hard not to feel like society has become so cynical and negative and tribal that people are more likely to ridicule these thoughts than consider them. I hope I'm wrong.

>"We want to raise our children so that they can take a sense of pleasure in both their own heritage and the diversity of others." ‚Äî Fred Rogers

items.content_html: Wasn’t aware that Google was forcibly disabling uBlock Origin in Chrome until I was hit with it today. So, Chrome uninstalled. (The only reason I installed Chrome was that YouTube TV played horribly in Safari, but last year, I decided to stop paying nearly 90 bucks a month for commercials anyway.)
items.content_text: Wasn't aware that Google was forcibly disabling uBlock Origin in Chrome until I was hit with it today. So, Chrome uninstalled. (The only reason I installed Chrome was that YouTube TV played horribly in Safari, but last year, I decided to stop paying nearly 90 bucks a month for commercials anyway.)

items.title: Lonnie Carmon
items.content_html:
On Columbus' 213th birthday, I thought I would share a wonderful photo of its first Black aviator, Lonnie Carmon (1901-1955).

Lonnie Carmon built this airplane in 1926 with a motorcycle engine. […] The homebuilt machine flew, but the pilot had to hide it in a barn in the Black community of Urbancrest for fear that some of the jealous pilots flying out of Norton Field would damage it. […] Saturday was always airplane day and Lonnie would pile the family into the Franklin sedan and drive to the flying field to give the whole family airplane rides.

(Photo and description by the Columbus Metropolitan Library/Arnett Howard)
items.content_text: On Columbus' 213th birthday, I thought I would share a wonderful photo of its first Black aviator, Lonnie Carmon (1901-1955). >Lonnie Carmon built this airplane in 1926 with a motorcycle engine. [...] The homebuilt machine flew, but the pilot had to hide it in a barn in the Black community of Urbancrest for fear that some of the jealous pilots flying out of Norton Field would damage it. [...] Saturday was always airplane day and Lonnie would pile the family into the Franklin sedan and drive to the flying field to give the whole family airplane rides. (Photo and description by the [Columbus Metropolitan Library/Arnett Howard](https://digital-collections.columbuslibrary.org/digital/collection/african/id/525/rec/14))

items.content_html: First Spaghetti Warehouse, now Jym Ganahl. I don’t even know this city anymore.
items.content_text: First Spaghetti Warehouse, now Jym Ganahl. I don't even know this city anymore.

items.content_html: Went down to see the demolition of the Spaghetti Warehouse building this morning. This restaurant has been woven throughout my entire life, and the building itself has stood for 134 years. The city is transforming rapidly. Progress, I guess.

items.content_html: N. 4th and 11th, Columbus. This building has been vacant and boarded-up as long as I can remember. My Dad frequently recalled the times he “snuck in” to see Bob Seger perform in the 1960s when it was a live music venue called “Sugar Shack”.

items.content_html: Finished reading: Johnny Carson by Henry Bushkin üìö As much an autobiography of Carson’s lawyer as a biography of Carson. He paints Carson as a very unhappy person despite his incredible comedic talents and wealth.
items.content_text: Finished reading: [Johnny Carson](https://micro.blog/books/9780544217621) by Henry Bushkin üìö As much an autobiography of Carson's lawyer as a biography of Carson. He paints Carson as a very unhappy person despite his incredible comedic talents and wealth.

items.content_html: I decided to provide those Nixon photos my Dad took to the Columbus Metropolitan Library for their digital archives. They’re here in the “Columbus Memory” collection. I’m sure he would’ve approved, and selfishly, it makes me feel good to contribute a few moments of his life to the city he loved.
items.content_text: I decided to provide [those Nixon photos my Dad took](/2025/02/02/clicking-through-the-columbus-librarys/) to the Columbus Metropolitan Library for their digital archives. They're [here](https://cdm16802.contentdm.oclc.org/digital/collection/memory/id/162916/rec/2) in the "Columbus Memory" collection. I'm sure he would've approved, and selfishly, it makes me feel good to contribute a few moments of his life to the city he loved.

items.content_html: Checked a very longstanding item off of my to-do list today: photographed the original Port Columbus airport terminal constructed in 1929.
items.content_text: Checked a _very_ longstanding item off of my to-do list today: photographed the original Port Columbus airport terminal constructed in 1929.

items.content_html: Clicking through the Columbus library’s archives lately has inspired me to share some of my own collection. It’s always bothered me that pictures get trapped inside albums and never seen again. Some pics of local interest: a radio station promotion in 1991 and a Nixon speech my Dad attended in 1970.
items.content_text: Clicking through the Columbus library's archives lately has inspired me to share some of my own collection. It's always bothered me that pictures get trapped inside albums and never seen again. Some pics of local interest: a [radio station promotion](https://mike.dunn.blog/26258 "Photos of a WNCI promotion for Easter Seals.") in 1991 and a [Nixon speech](https://mike.dunn.blog/26508 "President Richard Nixon speaking at the Ohio Statehouse in 1970.") my Dad attended in 1970.

items.content_html: I’m sitting in Columbus and using T-Mobile, which assigns me an IP address geolocated in Nashville, so when I load my WordPress site, Cloudflare pulls it from a cache in a data center in Atlanta, which in turn pulls from an origin server in – wait for it – Columbus. ü§™
items.content_text: I'm sitting in Columbus and using T-Mobile, which assigns me an IP address geolocated in Nashville, so when I load my WordPress site, Cloudflare pulls it from a cache in a data center in Atlanta, which in turn pulls from an origin server in -- wait for it -- Columbus. ü§™

items.content_html: Spent most of the past two days diagnosing why email from WordPress suddenly stopped. Very long story short, OpenSSL’s cert verification while connecting to Amazon SES was quietly failing. Still not sure how it broke, and the fix is an unsatisfying workaround, but it’s working now. Commence weekend.
items.content_text: Spent most of the past two days diagnosing why email from WordPress suddenly stopped. _Very_ long story short, OpenSSL's cert verification while connecting to Amazon SES was quietly failing. Still not sure how it broke, and the fix is an [unsatisfying workaround](https://medium.com/@erlandmuchasaj/starttls-stream-socket-enable-crypto-error-de7dea4e1a), but it's working now. Commence weekend.

items.content_html: My neighborhood was featured in one of those HGTV-style “which house did this couple pick?” articles in the New York Times: “Buying a House Sight-Unseen Is Hard Enough. They Did It From 10 Time Zones Away." Go Clintonville!
items.content_text: My neighborhood was featured in one of those HGTV-style "which house did this couple pick?" articles in the New York Times: ["Buying a House Sight-Unseen Is Hard Enough. They Did It From 10 Time Zones Away."](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2025/01/30/realestate/columbus-ohio-homes-sale.html) Go Clintonville!

items.content_html: Lately I’ve been finding myself getting lost in old photographs in the Columbus Metropolitan Library’s vast digital collection. There are historic moments like Lincoln’s funeral train moving through town and odd ones like Jayne Mansfield’s plane making a brief stop here. It truly is time traveling.
items.content_text: Lately I've been finding myself getting lost in old photographs in the Columbus Metropolitan Library's vast [digital collection](https://www.columbuslibrary.org/myhistory). There are historic moments like Lincoln's [funeral train moving through town](https://digital-collections.columbuslibrary.org/digital/collection/ohio/id/12727/rec/23) and odd ones like Jayne Mansfield's plane [making a brief stop here](https://digital-collections.columbuslibrary.org/digital/collection/ohio/id/18874/rec/1). It truly is time traveling.

items.content_html: Stumbled on this post about WordPress disabling attachment pages. For blogs, thumbs up! The media inside a blog post is the attachment, so why did it also need a separate page with no context? And, WordPress has never consistently attached posts in the media library anyway.
items.content_text: Stumbled on [this post](https://make.wordpress.org/core/2023/10/16/changes-to-attachment-pages/) about WordPress disabling attachment pages. For blogs, thumbs up! The media inside a blog post _is_ the attachment, so why did it also need a separate page with no context? And, WordPress has never consistently attached posts in the media library anyway.

items.title: Coco
items.content_html: A year ago today, this little girl left us. She was always bursting with personality and energy (and demands), and our house feels much emptier without her. (May misses her too, although she won’t admit it.)
items.content_text: A year ago today, this little girl left us. She was always bursting with personality and energy (and demands), and our house feels much emptier without her. ([May](https://micro.mikedunn.blog/2025/01/09/celebrating-gotcha-day-by-doing) misses her too, although she won't admit it.)

items.content_html: Finished reading: The Discovery of the Titanic by Robert D. Ballard üìö An interesting firsthand account of the 1985 discovery (a major media event those of us of a certain age remember well), and a reminder of what an accomplishment it was (for better or worse, depending on your take on subsequent visitors).
items.content_text: Finished reading: [The Discovery of the Titanic](https://micro.blog/books/9780446513852) by Robert D. items.content_html: Stopped by the former Wendy’s restaurant here in Columbus that briefly served as “Holy Chicken” for Morgan Spurlock’s 2017 sequel to Super Size Me. Over seven years later, it’s still looking for a tenant (and still has the green paint he added to give it a deceptively “healthy” look).
items.content_text: Stopped by the former Wendy's restaurant here in Columbus that briefly served as "Holy Chicken" for Morgan Spurlock's [2017 sequel to _Super Size Me_](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dSyicDf9UvI). Over seven years later, it's still looking for a tenant (and still has the green paint he added to give it a deceptively "healthy" look).

items.content_html: In today’s Columbus Dispatch: “From arsenal to education: Fort Hayes students work to preserve military complex’s history”. Always love hearing about the activities of students at my high school alma mater (which was an active military facility from the Civil War until 2009). Love visiting, too!
items.content_text: In today's Columbus Dispatch: ["From arsenal to education: Fort Hayes students work to preserve military complex's history"](https://www.dispatch.com/story/news/education/2025/01/06/fort-hayes-students-preserving-history-of-the-fort-turned-school/76924542007). Always love hearing about the activities of students at my high school alma mater (which was an active military facility from the Civil War until 2009). Love [visiting](https://mike.dunn.blog/18067), too!

items.content_html: The amount of panic these days over a few inches of snow is just hilarious to me. No ice, no subzero wind chills, just a few inches of snow. School and business closings galore.
items.content_text: The amount of panic these days over a few inches of snow is just hilarious to me. No ice, no subzero wind chills, just a few inches of snow. School and business closings galore.

items.content_html: Finished reading: Letterman by Jason Zinoman üìö A bit of a slog to get through this. A very detailed deconstruction of Letterman’s career, although it went a little too deep into the jockeying and infighting among his writing staff. It did remind me of something I loved about Late Night: Dave flinging blue cards through the fake window behind him.
items.content_text: Finished reading: [Letterman](https://micro.blog/books/9780062377241) by Jason Zinoman üìö A bit of a slog to get through this. A very detailed deconstruction of Letterman's career, although it went a little too deep into the jockeying and infighting among his writing staff. It did remind me of something I loved about _Late Night_: Dave [flinging blue cards through the fake window behind him](https://tenor.com/view/dave-letterman-viewer-mail-flip-a-card-letter-flipping-light-night-with-gif-26020347).

items.content_html: I remember watching the first live episode of the ‚Äò90s sitcom Roc, but I had forgotten that they did the entire second season live, too. The cast is so good, it‚Äôs hard to believe those episodes were all done in one take.
items.content_text: I remember watching the first live episode of the ‚Äò90s sitcom _Roc_, but I had forgotten that they did the entire second season live, too. The cast is so good, it‚Äôs hard to believe those episodes were all done in one take.
